title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation prioritizes facilities placed in service on or before that date. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is allocated by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. Facilities placed in service before that date have priority, followed by those placed in service after. The Secretary allocates unutilized national megawatt capacity limitations after December 31, 2020. Priority is given to facilities placed in service before that date. The Secretary allocates unutilized national megawatt capacity limitations after December 31, 2020, with priority given to facilities placed in service before that date. Amendments to Section 45J of the Code include the transfer of credits by certain public entities. Amendments to Section 45J of the Code allow for the transfer of credits by qualified public entities to eligible project partners. Qualified public entities can transfer credits to eligible project partners. The taxpayer for the credit is defined as a Federal, State, or local government entity, a mutual or cooperative electric company. The term 'eligible project partner' refers to individuals involved in designing or constructing an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for the tax credit. The provision of the nuclear steam supply system, nuclear fuel, or ownership interest in the advanced nuclear power facility qualifies for the tax credit. The tax credit applies to ownership interest in the advanced nuclear power facility, with special rules for partnerships. The tax credit for ownership interest in an advanced nuclear power facility includes special rules for partnerships, where the credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner after the qualified public entity's taxable year. Transfer benefits to an eligible project partner are subject to private use rules. The tax credit for ownership interest in an advanced nuclear power facility includes special rules for partnerships, where income derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election shall not be considered as private business use. The amendment regarding the treatment of unutilized limitation amounts will take effect upon the enactment of the Act, while the transfer of credit by certain public entities will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
